## Useful info

**Wizard statues** are a form of animated [statue](/Statue "Statue") which attacks you with a variety of powerful magic. They are only ever found in rare [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon") [vaults](/Vault "Vault").

## Spells

| Spell set |                                                           |
| :-------- | --------------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1     | [Freezing Cloud](/Freezing_Cloud "Freezing Cloud") (2d17) |
| Slot2     | [Mephitic Cloud](/Mephitic_Cloud "Mephitic Cloud")        |
| Slot3     | [Throw Icicle](/Throw_Icicle "Throw Icicle") (3d16)       |
| Slot4     | [Confuse](/Confuse "Confuse")                             |
| Slot5     | *none*                                                    |
| Slot6     | *none*                                                    |

## Tips & Tricks

- If you intend to charge in and smash them in melee, use rC+ and [conservation](/Conservation "Conservation") (or at least drop your [potions](/Potion "Potion") first) in preparation for the inevitable ice attacks. Having some [poison](/Poison "Poison") resistance will negate Mephitic Cloud, and [clarity](/Clarity "Clarity") or high [magic resistance](/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") will make it much less likely for you to wind up confused.
- Statues are stationary and don't regenerate, so you can hit them with ranged weapons from the edge of your [line of sight](/Line_of_sight "Line of sight"), stepping away to recover if injured.

## History

Wizard statues were removed in [0.14](/0.14 "0.14").

In this land of magic, it'd be foolish to assume that a statue of a wizard is always an inert piece of rock. This statue's hands and staff have very little dust compared to the base, suggesting it is capable of making magical gestures. The trap is too obvious, but dealing with it might not be.

Useful info

Wizard statues are a form of animated statue which attacks you with a variety of powerful magic. They are only ever found in rare Dungeon vaults.

Spells

Spell set
Slot1 Freezing Cloud (2d17)
Slot2 Mephitic Cloud
Slot3 Throw Icicle (3d16)
Slot4 Confuse
Slot5 none
Slot6 none

Tips & Tricks

  • If you intend to charge in and smash them in melee, use rC+ and conservation (or at least drop your potions first) in preparation for the inevitable ice attacks. Having some poison resistance will negate Mephitic Cloud, and clarity or high magic resistance will make it much less likely for you to wind up confused.
  • Statues are stationary and don't regenerate, so you can hit them with ranged weapons from the edge of your line of sight, stepping away to recover if injured.

History

Wizard statues were removed in 0.14.
